article_title: Alaska Legislature OKs spending $450K to sue Gov. Walker over Medicaid expansion
article_text:
Nathaniel Herz

Nathaniel Herz grew up in Maine and moved to Alaska in 2013 to work at the Anchorage Daily News after surviving two years in New York City, where he received a masters degree from the Columbia Graduate School of Journalism and reported for Newsday and the New York World. He started his career in journalism in 2009 covering cross-country skiing and biathlon for the website FasterSkier.com, and enjoys a good day out on the trails at Kincaid Park.

article_metadata.description: The Alaska Legislature on Tuesday said it would sue Gov. Bill Walker to block his move last month to use his executive power to expand the public Medicaid health care program.

og.description: The Alaska Legislature on Tuesday said it would sue Gov. Bill Walker to block his move last month to use his executive power to expand the public Medicaid health care program.
og.title: Alaska Legislature OKs spending $450K to sue Gov. Walker over Medicaid expansion
